Text: Revised Schedule for Round Spring TCC AuctionThe NYISO is revising the schedule for posting of the TCC awards from Round of the Spring TCC Auction This revision will affect the scheduled activities for several rounds of this auction as follows March Post TCC awards for Round March Round bidding opens at am EST and closes at pm EST March Post TCC awards for Round March Round bidding opens at am EST and closes at pm EST Bidding opens for the April Reconfiguration Auction of TCCs at am EST and closes at pm EST March Post TCC awards for Round Post TCC awards for the April Reconfiguration Auction of TCCs The remainder of the schedule for the Spring TCC Auction remains unchanged You are currently subscribed to nyisotie as To unsubscribe send a blank email to

OC Approval of Locational ICAP RequirementsToday the Operating Committee approved the Locational Installed Capacity Requirements for the NYCA covering the period May through April The NYISO report Locational Installed Capacity Requirements Study Covering the New York Control Area for the Capability Year has been reposted to the NYISO website Please use the web address provided below to find this document The following revisions have been made to the posting of this report In Table the peak load ICAP LCR and UCAP LCR for New York City and Long Island have been revised to correct typos in the peak load values that effect the calculation of the ICAP LCR and UCAP LCR An explanation has been provided for the large reduction in the Long Island locational requirements servicesdocumentsstudiesindexhtmlp You are currently subscribed to nyisotie as To unsubscribe send a blank email to

Round Spring TCC Auction Delayed Posting of ResultsThe NYISO is revising the schedule for posting of the TCC awards from Round of the Spring TCC Auction This revision will affect the scheduled activities for several rounds of this auction as follows March Post TCC awards for Round March Round bidding opens at am EST and closes at pm EST Bidding opens for the April Reconfiguration Auction of TCCs at am EST and closes at pm EST March Post TCC awards for Round Post TCC awards for the April Reconfiguration Auction of TCCs March Round bidding opens at am EST and closes at pm EST March Post TCC awards for Round March Round bidding opens at am EST and closes at pm EST March Post TCC awards for Round The remainder of the schedule for the Initial Spring TCC Auction remains unchanged You are currently subscribed to nyisotie as To unsubscribe send a blank email to

ICAP Announcement Revision to Con Edison Transmission District UCAP writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Due to the terrorist actions in NYC which collapsed offices in the World Trade Center complex and reduced customer Load in that Transmission District the ISO is recalculating the Unforced Capacity UCAP requirement for the Consolidated Edison Transmission District CETD and the New York Control Area The new UCAP requirement for the CETD for the Capability Period to is MW and the total UCAP requirement for the New York Control Area is MW Changes in the UCAP requirements of affected LSEs will be provided to them individually today The table below provides a comparison of the revised UCAP requirements to those in effect prior to this revision Revised In Effect Prior Reduction to Statewide MW MW MW CETD MW MW MW InCity MW MW MW

ICAP Announcement Monthly ICAP Auction writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Due to problems with the NYISOs internal Local Area Network the Winter PreCapability Period ICAP Auction will be delayed by one day to Thursday October The events and dates that follow the October auction will remain unchanged A revised time line is provided below Winter PreCapability Period ICAP Auction Events Revised Time Line ICAP Auction Event Original Date Revised Date PreCapability Period Monthly Auction PreCapability Period Monthly Auction Post Results Email Award Notices LSE Supplier UCAP Certification PreCapability Period Deficiency Auction PreCapability Period Deficiency Auction Post Results Email Award Notices

UCAP Translated InCity Cap Applicable to Mitigated Generators writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List As directed by FERC in its September Order in docket ER the NYISO has completed the calculation of the revenue neutral translation into Unforced Capacity terms of the InCity cap applicable to Generators subject to market power mitigation measures In the September Order the Commission decided that the translated incity price cap is to be fixed at an amount determined on the day of the first incity capacity auction under UCAP methodology using data from the most recent month period On the basis of Operating Data received by the NYISO the Capacityweighted EFORd for all Generators subject to market power mitigation measures for the Winter Capability Period Auction is Thus the InCity cap under the UCAP market design including the Capability Period Auction scheduled for October is
